news.title: Buying homes in Ghaziabad could become costly as city sees hike in development fee
news.para: Ghaziabad homebuyers face a significant blow as the UP government has drastically increased development fees by over 66%, the steepest hike in the state. This substantial rise, from Rs 2,500/sqm to Rs 4,170/sqm, will inevitably push up plot and flat prices, impacting affordability for many aspiring homeowners.

news.title: Infosys' land sale among transactions Karnataka opens probe into for bypassing e-khata
news.para: The revenue authorities have made e-khata, or the digital version of a property’s official record, a compulsory document for the seller to produce for registering a property. The Kaveri 2.0 portal is designed to fetch the e-khata from the e-Swathu portal during registration.

news.title: Bombay HC stops BMC from demolishing homes in Rakhmabai Mhatre Chawl
news.para: The Bombay High Court has shielded six Mulund residents from demolition by the BMC, deeming the notices "vague, arbitrary, malafide and a colourable exercise of power." The court found the action, driven by redevelopment interests, lacked proper hearing and evidence, protecting the long-standing occupants until their civil suits conclude.

news.title: SC serves notice to Centre & CPCB, seeks reply on plea against NGT order in Gurugram's Ambience Lagoon case
news.para: The Supreme Court has issued notices to the Centre and CPCB regarding a civil appeal challenging an NGT order that dismissed allegations of illegal construction on protected forest land. Retired IFS officer RK Sharma and journalist Pawan Kumar Bansal filed the appeal, claiming commercial construction on forest land near the Delhi-Gurgaon border.

news.title: Gurugram: Dubbed unsafe to live four years ago, four NBCC Green View towers to be razed
news.para: Gurgaon administration has approved the demolition of four unsafe towers at NBCC Green View, clearing the path for reconstruction. The decision follows structural audits deeming the buildings unsafe for habitation, with demolition deemed the only viable option after considering allottee views. Strict safety and environmental norms will govern the phased demolition and rebuilding process.

news.title: NCLAT upholds Lucknow development body's plea in Ansal insolvency case
news.para: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) ruled that no order can be passed in Ansal Properties' insolvency proceedings without hearing the Lucknow Development Authority (LDA). This decision comes after the LDA challenged the NCLAT's earlier admission of the insolvency plea without their notification, despite pending dues of thousands of crores.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body collects ₹24 crore under property tax rebate scheme
news.para: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's property tax rebate scheme has seen a strong start, with 24,887 taxpayers benefiting and over Rs 24 crore collected in just seven days. The incentive offers significant interest waivers for both old and new tax formulas, encouraging prompt payment across all property types.

news.title: NGT seeks report on four encroached ponds in Gurugram, cites SC order on restoration
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has given the Haryana government two months to respond to a petition alleging encroachment on four city ponds, including one with a three-storey office built over it. The tribunal emphasized Supreme Court rulings mandating the protection and restoration of ponds, with the next hearing scheduled for April 10.

news.title: Chhattisgarh launches PMAY houses powered with solar power for tribal households
news.para: Chhattisgarh has launched a pioneering initiative, installing rooftop solar plants on PM Janman Awas homes for Pahadi Korwa families. This unique model, the first of its kind in India, aims to provide vulnerable tribal households with both pucca houses and virtually zero electricity bills, ensuring assured solar power for the poorest.

news.title: USA President threatens to ban Wall Street investments in single-family homes
news.para: President Donald Trump has unveiled a plan to restrict Wall Street firms from buying single-family homes. This initiative is designed to drive down housing prices, making the dream of homeownership more attainable for many Americans.

news.title: NGT issues notice to Centre, others in plea alleging mishandling of solid waste at cement plant
news.para: The National Green Tribunal is probing claims of improper waste management at Ultra Tech Cement's Dalla facility in Sonbhadra. To address these claims, the tribunal has sent summons to the central government, regional authorities, pollution regulators, and the cement company.

news.title: Himachal Pradesh govt promoting planned development for affordable, eco-friendly housing: Minister
news.para: In Himachal Pradesh, a thoughtful approach to development is underway, emphasizing both affordability and environmental sustainability in housing. The Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) plays a crucial role in safeguarding the rights of homebuyers, effectively mediating disputes and fostering a climate of trust within the real estate market.

news.title: Home sales in Toronto fall for a third straight month in December 2025
news.para: December saw a continuation of the slide in home sales in the Greater Toronto Area, marking three months of decline. A climate of economic uncertainty left many buyers hesitant, leading to the lowest sales levels since June. The board's home price index also indicated a downward adjustment this month.

news.title: Residential sales in top eight cities hold steady in 2025 at 3.48 lakh units: Report
news.para: In 2025, the Indian housing market saw a modest decline in sales compared to the previous year. Yet, a turnaround was evident in the latter half, marking the strongest performance since 2013. Developers launched more new homes than they sold, reflecting a surge in confidence.

news.title: Jaipur civic body seals four buildings over UD tax dues
news.para: Jaipur Municipal Corporation has sealed four properties in Civil Lines zone for pending urban development tax. Five property owners paid their dues, generating Rs 12 lakh. The corporation emphasized no leniency for defaulters, stating attachment and sealing actions will continue to ensure revenue for city development.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body collects impact fee for two houses built on government land
news.para: Members of Devmandir Co-operative Housing Society in Ghatlodia allege Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation officials collected illegal impact fees. The fees were for two houses built on government land, falsely linked to their society. An appeal was filed under the Gruda Act, 2022, seeking cancellation of the applications and legal action against officials. Evidence suggests the houses are not on society land.

news.title: Illegal construction rampant in Raisina hill; boundary walls, roads razed & borewells sealed
news.para: Forest officials in Gurgaon demolished illegal structures and boundary walls spanning 25 acres in the protected Aravalis, following National Green Tribunal directives. A borewell was sealed, and roads accessing the forest were blocked. Despite repeated drives and court orders, construction persists, with environmentalists questioning the administration's commitment to enforcement.

news.title: India office leasing touches 86.4 million sq ft in 2025: Report
news.para: In 2025, India's office market  achieved 86.4 million sq ft in gross leasing volumes, marking a 20% increase compared to 2024. Bengaluru emerged as the frontrunner, witnessing a surge in leasing activities, while Global Capability Centres significantly fueled the demand.

news.title: Hyderabad: ED files supplementary complaint in Sahiti Infratec money laundering case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a supplementary prosecution complaint against two key accused in the Sahiti Infratec Ventures India Pvt Ltd fraud case. The ED's money-laundering probe alleges over 700 homebuyers were duped of approximately ₹360 crore by SIVIPL, which operated without necessary approvals and diverted funds through dubious transactions.
